DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Occurrence Diagnosis Basis Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the diagnosis that chronic graft versus host disease was based on.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to histology.: Clinical manifestations that can be either objective when observed by a physician, or subjective when perceived by the patient.: Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options: Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.: Confirmed; having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Basis; the fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provides the foundation for something.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
The fundamental assumptions underlying an explanation or a relation that provide the foundation for something.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Diagnosis of chronic GVHD was
ReferenceDocuments.description: Diagnosis of chronic GVHD was based on:

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2793799
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedDiagnosis > PerformedObservation > AssessedResultRelationship > PerformedMedicalConditionResult.value WHERE PerformedDiagnosis.value = "GVHD" AND PerformedDiagnosis.diseaseStatusCode = "Chronic"
